title: How to Make a Santa Cake

steps.headline: Make or buy two round sponge cakes, one large for Santa's body - one small for Santa's head.
Make or buy a rectangular sponge cake of the same depth.
steps.description: This is for Santa's arms and legs.

steps.headline: Place the large round sponge cake on a cake board covered in aluminum foil, leaving enough room for Santa's head and arms and legs.
Cut an arc out of the large round sponge cake (Santa's body) so Santa's head fits snugly.
steps.description: It is possible to use the small cake tin as a template.

steps.headline: Place the smaller sponge into the cut out arc.
steps.description: The cakes should now resemble a figure-8, the top part smaller representing Santa's head.

steps.headline: Cut two small square pieces from the rectangular cake for Santa's hands.
Cut from the rectangular sponge cake two larger pieces for Santa's feet.
Place the hand and feet cake pieces equidistant around the circumference of the large sponge, taking into consideration the arc Santa's head has covered.
Make or prepare the icing you'll need as the cake is now ready for decorative icing!
Decorate the clothing areas of your Santa cake in white and red icing, using your imagination to depict his coat.
steps.description: Use pink and white for his and jolly face and beard.

steps.headline: Add Jelly Beans as buttons and eyes.
steps.description: Licorice sweets can be used to construct a belt, candy bananas to use as Santa's lips.

text: Make or buy two round sponge cakes, one large for Santa's body - one small for Santa's head.  Make or buy a rectangular sponge cake of the same depth. This is for Santa's arms and legs. Place the large round sponge cake on a cake board covered in aluminum foil, leaving enough room for Santa's head and arms and legs.  Cut an arc out of the large round sponge cake (Santa's body) so Santa's head fits snugly. It is possible to use the small cake tin as a template. Place the smaller sponge into the cut out arc. The cakes should now resemble a figure-8, the top part smaller representing Santa's head. Cut two small square pieces from the rectangular cake for Santa's hands.  Cut from the rectangular sponge cake two larger pieces for Santa's feet.  Place the hand and feet cake pieces equidistant around the circumference of the large sponge, taking into consideration the arc Santa's head has covered.  Make or prepare the icing you'll need as the cake is now ready for decorative icing!  Decorate the clothing areas of your Santa cake in white and red icing, using your imagination to depict his coat. Use pink and white for his and jolly face and beard. Add Jelly Beans as buttons and eyes. Licorice sweets can be used to construct a belt, candy bananas to use as Santa's lips.
